issue.title: [CF 569] Impending Victory range check seems to not work...
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Setup a button tracking "Impending Victory" spell cooldown.
2. Select range check (I have range and power check selected)
3. Melee the dummy ... back out of melee range ... all range-check melee buttons work properly except Impending Victory.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
To grey out / disappear like the rest of my range check buttons.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.0.3 r567

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav | Imported from CurseForge issue #569 | Raw

comments.body:
Seems like a bug with Blizzard. See http://us.battle.net/wow/en/forum/topic/6036613925

Not exactly sure how to go about fixing this. Tracking the range of Victory Rush works, and tracking VR as the cooldown instead of IV works, but with the current way TMW processes spells combined with the way Blizzard's API handles these "Replaces x" spells ends up turning the range check spell into IV anyway. Plus, its not very intuitive to have to track VR instead of IV to get things to work properly.

In the meantime, you can add a condition to the icon to check the range of another normal melee spell.

Edited Sep 1, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Cybeloras,

I am fine with the work-around - I would rather have the functionality work as it does. I will turn off the integrated range check and add a condition to range change another melee spell as you noted. Thanks for the prompt reply and work-around suggestion. Go ahead and close this ticket off.

Stanoslav

Edited Sep 1, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav
